description:
Bug #700867 is still unfixed: with slightly less common circumstances you can still trip over it.

In the case that my_ip cannot be discovered using the standing detection mechanism (in my case, I have a network connection that bounces at the critical moment in the startup - but any machine without a default route would likely have similar issues), then it defaults to 127.0.0.1.  

metadata_host (unset) defaults to my_ip.

nova-network then adds the rewrite iptables rule for the metadata server with a 127.0.0.1 target, which fails to work.  (And unfortunately looks perfectly reasonable as a rule, resulting in much gnashing of teeth until you work out why the rule is being used and yet not working.)
title: Metadata is still broken in a default install, if you're unlucky

comments.content: at any time you should specify the  my_ip or  metadata_host  in your nova.conf
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~heut2008

comments.content:
This is true.  However, you have to know to set my_ip or metadata_host, and that's not at all obvious from the symptoms.  Also, metadata_host = 127.0.0.1 does not work (with libvirt, at least), and yet metadata_host = 127.0.0.1 is the default value that you would get on a disconnected host, the default settings system leads this to happen.

(The same statement - that you can simply set metadata_host - was equally true of the original bug, which was nevertheless fixed.)
